source.9fedde54:
my_data = lis1
my_labels = 'India','China','USA','Rest Of World'
my_explode = (0, 0, 0,0.1)
plt.pie(my_data,labels=my_labels,autopct='%1.1f%%',startangle=30, shadow = True, explode=my_explode,colors=['lightblue','lightgrey','lightsteelblue','gold'])
plt.title('GLOBAL SHARE OF EMISSIONS IN LAST 20 YEARS')
plt.axis('equal')
plt.show()

source.1cc78af2:
restofworldoverallnew=(worldnew-Econ["2017"].sum())
TopEconomiesnew=Econ["2017"].sum()

liss2=[TopEconomiesnew,restofworldoverallnew]
my_data = liss2
my_labels = ['Top 10 Economies','Rest Of World']
my_explode = (0,0.1)
plt.pie(my_data,labels=my_labels,autopct='%1.1f%%',startangle=30, shadow = True, explode=my_explode,colors=['lightsteelblue','gold'])
plt.title('Global Share Of Greenhouse Emissions In 2017')
plt.axis('equal')
plt.show()

source.abd0bcbb: A Greenhouse Gas is a gas that absorbs and emits radiant energy within the thermal infrared range, causing the greenhouse effect. The primary greenhouse gases in Earth's atmosphere are water vapor, carbon dioxide, methane, nitrous oxide, and ozone.
